snippet: The circumstances of the violence, which left at least 15 people dead, were contested by the Iraqi government and representatives of the group of dissidents.
abstract: Clashes at camp in northeastern Iraq that houses group of Iranian dissidents, who until 2012 were considered terrorists by the United States government, leaves at least 15 people dead; circumstances of the violence, as well as number of casualties, has been contested by both Iraqi government and group's representatives.
lead_paragraph: The circumstances of the violence, which left at least 15 people dead, were contested by the Iraqi government and representatives of the group of dissidents.

headline.main: Iraqi Camp for Iranians Faces Deadly Clashes
headline.print_headline: Clashes at Iraq Camp for Iranians
